ai-ja449:1.4_0: What’s the point of this miserable?”
ai-ja449:2.4_0: through that life I may give up suffering.
ai-ja449:3.1_0: “This is the color of my belly,
ai-ja449:3.4_0: I am the wheel-turning monarch, sought it for him.”
ai-ja449:4.1_0: The student said: “So it was a young brāhmaṇa
ai-ja449:4.2_0: Candana and Sā, here who were brothers,
ai-ja449:5.2_0: is the one who understands (of them),
ai-ja449:5.3_0: I think you’ll die in your mind!
ai-ja449:5.4_0: for you haven’t got the Sun.”
ai-ja449:6.3_0: but still you won’t see the ghost.
ai-ja449:7.3_0: like a turban from a sea.
ai-ja449:8.1_0: The peaceful one, who is burning,
ai-ja449:8.3_0: like a drilling the head with the wind.
ai-ja449:9.1_0: For you have plucked the dart from me,
ai-ja449:9.2_0: When they’re released from the heart
ai-ja449:9.4_0: in which I once was mired.
ai-ja449:10.2_0: free of greed, free of hate,
